docs.snippet: The Obama administration said it was tossing out 35 intelligence operatives and imposing sanctions on Russian intelligence services and officers....

headline.main: Obama Strikes Back at Russia for Election Hacking
headline.print_headline: U.S. Punishes Russia Over Election Hacking

byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow.

docs.snippet: The United States struck back Thursday at Russia for hacking the U.S. presidential campaign with a sweeping set of punishments targeting Russia's spy agencies and diplomats. The U.S. said Russia must bear costs for its actions, but Moscow called t...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States struck back Thursday at Russia for hacking the U.S. presidential campaign with a sweeping set of punishments targeting Russia's spy agencies and diplomats. The U.S. said Russia must bear costs for its actions, but Moscow called the Obama administration "losers" and threatened retaliation.

headline.main: US Punishes Russia for Hacking Presidential Campaign
headline.print_headline: US Punishes Russia for Hacking Presidential Campaign

docs.snippet: Supporters of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump have appropriated the phrase "basket of deplorables" - used by Hillary Clinton during the campaign to pillory some of his backers - to plan an inauguration party called the "Deploraball."...
docs.lead_paragraph: Supporters of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump have appropriated the phrase "basket of deplorables" - used by Hillary Clinton during the campaign to pillory some of his backers - to plan an inauguration party called the "Deploraball."

docs.snippet: Of the many events marking the closing year of Barack Obama's time as the nation's first black president, none had deeper resonance than his opening of the National Museum of African-American History and Culture on the National Mall. Tracing the h...
docs.lead_paragraph: Of the many events marking the closing year of Barack Obama's time as the nation's first black president, none had deeper resonance than his opening of the National Museum of African-American History and Culture on the National Mall. Tracing the history of black America from its dark beginnings in human bondage to Obama's historic election, the museum has already welcomed more than 600,000 visitors.
